original_solution_mapping.L1: He needs 48 pounds of flour because 12 x 4 = <<12*4=48>>48
original_solution_mapping.L2: He needs 4.8 bags of 10 pound bags because 48 / 10 = <<48/10=4.8>>4.8
original_solution_mapping.L3: He therefore needs to buy 5 bags of flour because 4 < 4.8 < 5
original_solution_mapping.L4: He spends $50 if he buys this flour because 5 x 10 = <<5*10=50>>50
original_solution_mapping.L5: He needs 4 bags of the 12-pound flour because 48 / 12 = <<48/12=4>>4
original_solution_mapping.L6: He would spend $52 on the 12-pound bags because 4 x 13 = 52
original_solution_mapping.L7: He spends $50 if he buys the cheapest flour because 50 < 52

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 303.
    Returns: the amount Tommy spends on flour.
    """
    # L1
    num_loaves = 12 # 12 loaves of bread
    flour_per_loaf = 4 # 4 pounds of flour per loaf
    total_flour_needed = num_loaves * flour_per_loaf

    # L2
    flour_bag_size_10lb = 10 # A 10-pound bag of flour
    num_bags_10lb_exact = total_flour_needed / flour_bag_size_10lb

    # L3
    lower_bound_10lb_bags = int(num_bags_10lb_exact)
    num_bags_10lb_actual = int(num_bags_10lb_exact) if num_bags_10lb_exact == int(num_bags_10lb_exact) else int(num_bags_10lb_exact) + 1

    # L4
    cost_10lb_bag = 10 # A 10-pound bag of flour costs $10
    cost_for_10lb_bags = num_bags_10lb_actual * cost_10lb_bag

    # L5
    flour_bag_size_12lb = 12 # a 12-pound bag
    num_bags_12lb_exact = total_flour_needed / flour_bag_size_12lb

    # L6
    cost_12lb_bag = 13 # a 12-pound bag costs $13
    cost_for_12lb_bags = num_bags_12lb_exact * cost_12lb_bag

    # L7
    cheapest_cost = min(cost_for_10lb_bags, cost_for_12lb_bags)

    # FA
    answer = cheapest_cost
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: He needs {total_flour_needed} pounds of flour because {num_loaves} x {flour_per_loaf} = <<{num_loaves}*{flour_per_loaf}={total_flour_needed}>>{total_flour_needed}

He needs {num_bags_10lb_exact} bags of {flour_bag_size_10lb} pound bags because {total_flour_needed} / {flour_bag_size_10lb} = <<{total_flour_needed}/{flour_bag_size_10lb}={num_bags_10lb_exact}>>{num_bags_10lb_exact}
He therefore needs to buy {num_bags_10lb_actual} bags of flour because {lower_bound_10lb_bags} < {num_bags_10lb_exact} < {num_bags_10lb_actual}
He spends ${cost_for_10lb_bags} if he buys this flour because {num_bags_10lb_actual} x {cost_10lb_bag} = <<{num_bags_10lb_actual}*{cost_10lb_bag}={cost_for_10lb_bags}>>{cost_for_10lb_bags}

He needs {num_bags_12lb_exact} bags of the {flour_bag_size_12lb}-pound flour because {total_flour_needed} / {flour_bag_size_12lb} = <<{total_flour_needed}/{flour_bag_size_12lb}={num_bags_12lb_exact}>>{num_bags_12lb_exact}
He would spend ${cost_for_12lb_bags} on the {flour_bag_size_12lb}-pound bags because {num_bags_12lb_exact} x {cost_12lb_bag} = {cost_for_12lb_bags}
He spends ${cheapest_cost} if he buys the cheapest flour because {cost_for_10lb_bags} < {cost_for_12lb_bags}

explanation: Incorrect operand. The variable 'flour_per_loaf' (value: 4) was used instead of 'cost_for_12lb_bags' (value: 52.0).
